item.description:
I am originally from Atlanta, Georgia, and am a proud ramblin’ wreck from Georgia Tech. After college, I studied psychology and quantitative methods, receiving my Ph.D. from Vanderbilt University (2008). I am now a data scientist and professional educator at RStudio. Prior to that, I was an Assistant Professor at Arizona State University, and an Associate Professor at Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU).

My research focused on health-related applications of Natural Language Processing-based methods, and was funded by the National Institutes of Health, the Oregon Clinical and Translational Research Institute, and Autism Speaks. I have written numerous scientific publications on autism and neurodevelopmental disorders and have presented my research at over 25 international conferences.

While at OHSU, I became an avid user of the statistical programming language R, both in the lab as a Principal Investigator and in the classroom as a professor. I developed a passion for programming and education, and during my tenure at OHSU I developed and taught multiple graduate-level data science courses and workshops. I also trained the Office of Research Impact at the Oregon Clinical & Translational Research Institute to use R, and consulted with the University of Oregon College of Education on the development of a graduate data science specialization track. I received an Excellence in Education award from OHSU in 2018.

You can follow my current work for RStudio Education on GitHub. In my free time, I love spending time with my family and my two-year-old daughter. Thank you so much for reading.

item.title: Teaching
item.description:
I’ve taught throughout most of my professional career. Currently I am a Lead Instructor of Data Science at Flatiron School in London, England and have just recently become a certified RStudio Instructor. Prior to working at Flatiron School, I had designed and delivered workshops with Minerva Statistical Consulting teaching.

Before teaching data science and programming, I taught throughout most of my Ph.D in both the music department where I taught classes on Aural Skills and Music Theory to undergraduates and for the Department of Psychology where I was a teaching assistant for the graduate level statistics courses. You can see evidence of my teaching below in my teaching portfolio.

Workshops

I offer tranings and workshops on various topics on topics related to data science and am open to designing bespoke materials in order to suit your needs. I specialize in teaching beginners with little to no experience in data science. Below are a listing of workshops I have delivered before:

  • Two day crash course on R
  • R for Python
  • Tidyverse
  • ggplot
  • R for Psychologists
  • Data Science topics

If you want to get in contact about booking a workshop in person or online, SEE FORM BELOW.

  • PICTURES HERE
  • CONTAT FORM

Teaching Portfolio

Below you can explore my teaching portfolio. Here you can find videos of me teaching both online and in the classroom, examples of the types of documents that I produce for learners, listings of courses or lectures that I have taught, as well as student reviews. I also include my current teaching and diversity statements, two documents that resulted from applying for teaaching positions at North American Universities.
